title: Stats
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user poses the query for a player's stats:

what is {playerName} {statCategory},
i.e. "What is David Ortiz's batting average?"
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats

title: Stats in Specific Time Period (YYYY)
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user poses the query for a player's stats:

what is {playerName} {statCategory}  in {timePeriod}, 
i.e. "What is David Ortiz's batting average in 2015?"
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats for the specified time period

title: Stats in Specific Time Period (MM/YYYY)
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user poses the query for a player's stats:

what is {playerName} {statCategory}  in {timePeriod} {timePeriod}, 
i.e. "What is David Ortiz's batting average in April 2015?"
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats in specific time period

title: Stats in Preposition and Split Specific Time Period (YYYY)
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user poses the query for a player's stats:

what was {playerName} {statCategory} {preposition} {split} in {timePeriod},
i.e. What was David Ortiz's batting average before the All-Star break in 2015?
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats specified time period

title: Stats Categories
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats

title: Time Periods
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats in the requested time period

title: Historical, Single Player Stat
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user poses the query for a historical, single player stat
i.e. "Who is the ALL TIME HOME RUN leader?"
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats in the requested time period

title: Historical, Multiple Players Stat
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user poses the query for a historical, multiple players stat
i.e. "Who are the ALL TIME HOME RUN leaders?"
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats in the requested time period

title: Historical, Single Season
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user poses the query for a historical, single season
i.e. "Who has the best SINGLE SEASON OPS?"
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats in the requested time period

title: Player + Stat + Date Range (2 variables)
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user poses the query for a player + stat + date range (2 variables)
i.e. "What was DAVID ORTIZ's OPS AFTER the ALL STAR BREAK in 2014?"
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats in the requested time period

title: Player Nickname + Stat
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has signed in with a MLB.com account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user poses the query for a player nickname + stat
i.e. "What is BIG PAPI's OPS?"
custom_expected: THEN Alexa will respond with the corresponding player's stats

title: EDIT_Questions
custom_preconds:
See the attached Excel Spreadsheet which contains 100 questions, got this document from Slack's #proj-bambot, uploaded:

Andrew Patterson [3:29 PM] on July 6, 2017:  Similar to the game info questions i asked the interns to come with some stats related questions that they want to ask a bot. The above list is a 100 questions that they came up w/
custom_steps: Category (WAR, WP, RBG, AB, R, H, K, K/9, BA, 2B, 3B, HR, RBI, SB, OBP, SLG, OPS, OPS+)
